intro: Lepidaploa juruenensis, commonly known as the Juruenensis Lepidaploa, is a species of flowering plant native to the Amazon Basin. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves with a smooth surface. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within the undergrowth of tropical rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and understudied species.
